p: Among the 21 candidate SNPs tested (Nadeau et al., 2016), 12 were confirmed in this study (10 genes; Fig. 6; Table 2): three SNPs (three genes) were significantly associated with dendrometric traits DBH 21 and H 21, while 11 SNPs (nine genes) were associated with tree‐ring traits (types A, B and C). As many as 10 SNPs (eight genes) were associated with the climate‐related type B and type C traits (seven SNP–trait associations classified as very likely, five likely and eight uncertain). Traits reflecting responses to specific freezing events (BAI 2003, CS BAI–Freeze.Oct ( t−1) , and CS BAI–Freeze.Jun ( t) ) were associated with SNPs G‐001, G‐004, M‐016, M‐017, N‐029, N‐033, N‐040 and O‐002. CS traits reflecting heat and drought tolerance (CS BAI–Temp.Jul ( t) , CS BAI–Prec.Jul ( t) , CS BAI–Drought.Aug ( t) ) were associated with SNPs G‐014, M‐015, M‐016, N‐029, N‐033 and N‐040.
